skillTree.localised_description: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.

Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

skillTree.localised_description: The pain of immortal misery, coupled with insane violence, characterises the return to Unlife for many of the Tomb Kings, who fight longer, harder and better than they ever could before.
You cannot build an empire without sacrificing a few sons…
The fluid used to embalm the Tomb King toughens his bindings, enabling him to withstand a greater degree of damage than would otherwise be possible.
Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The heat of the love shared between Rasut and her King blazed so hot that Basth herself was said to keep warm around it on cold desert nights. But the intensity of such love itself proved a distraction for the King of Khemri, and he forsook his wife, concubines and royal court to spend more and more time at the Temple of Basth, communing with the High Priestess of the Goddess of Love who in the fullness of time fell pregnant. This lack of attention proved his undoing sadly, as while he was besotted, Khemri’s enemies moved secretly to plot against him. The conspiracy of Zandri and Numas to kill the King and install his much more soft and pliable brother bore fruit on a night of the long knives, the King assassinated on the steps of Basth’s Temple itself. With the twelve in line for the throne before him dead, the King’s brother was set to be crowned and he to reward his benefactors. Then Basth intervened. Outraged at the sacrilege on her temple’s steps, and beseeched by her High Priestess for the power to slay her lovers killers, Basth granted Rasut with blessings usually reserved for her most devoted Ushabti and sent to her feline servants from around Khemri to fight for her cause. A veritable Lioness, the grief stricken Rasut cleansed the royal court of all who stood against Khemri. The heartache and anguish she felt being a channel for her swift daggers and intense magic to do it’s work. With the royal court and the Kings family all dead and in disarray Rasut demanded the throne in the name of her unborn son. With her plans to empower the priesthood and send Khemri’s armies to defend against Zandri and Numas clear, the Mortuary Cult quickly moved to install this clearly blessed by the gods priestess as Khemri’s newest Queen.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: Though all cats are sacred to Basth, none is more sacred than the form most often taken by the goddess themselves, the black panther. Each noviciate to the Priesthood of Basth is presented with a sanctified panther cub on passing their initial trials who becomes their constant companion. Kept strong and powerful, these hunters are companions and friends but never pets, for their duties include the fierce protection of the priesthood and the Temple grounds. Receiving Hubualtafani as a cub, Rasut hand-reared her lifelong friend until he was a powerful ally. He was by her side throughout her life and upon her death on the battlefield was said to have been called by Basth to the realm of souls itself to join her. No mere animated animal, Rasut calls forth this mighty champion of Basth from the canopic jars holding his remains to come from the spirit realm and fight once again.

In life these cats were beloved by their owners. All Nehekharan’s worshipped Basth, for to do so was to invite love and friendship into their lives. To deny yourself a divine cat was to reject such attachments. Cats were the much prized gifts given to wedding couples, or between lovers as a sign of the depth of their devotion. As in life in death too. As to not be buried with a cat to be your friend in the afterlife was to deny yourself love forever, to contemplate an everlasting life without grace, tenderness or affection. The cats were buried solemnly and at great expense, each not only an enternal companion, but also a sign to Basth of dedication. Empowered by their Priestess the Bastethi in Rasut’s army remember more of their grace they had in life and are able to twist and dodge more like they did in life.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even thousands of years later Rasut is still driven by the intensity of love she felt to protect her then unborn son and protect his legacy. Sadly the transition to undeath has clouded her judgement, and she now is prone to forgetting that she won, and he was born. As with all Tomb Kings she is sometimes locked into her most extreme memories, reliving a passage of time from her mortal life and thinking it is that time again. Perhaps this is for the best, for while the memory of the passion she felt in life drives her to pinnacles of endless energy, the realisation of what happened to her son after she died drives her to almost immobility. Rasut’s passages of lucidity and open awareness of her current state often lead her to sit for decades at a time barely able to move and heartbroken. In a way Rasut almost welcomes the insanity of the Tomb Kings that sometimes grips her, for at least then she is powerful, vital and an instrument of divine justice. The reality that she died and was unable to protect her son crushes her to an almost endless despair.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -10% for Bastethi and Greater Bastethi units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: The High Priestess of Basth reaches deep into the Realm of Souls to the places of the primal hunting cats who roam Basth’s domain. These souls empower the Bastethi to new heights, with their sole desire while briefly on the mortal realm to enjoy their hunting and stalking once again.

skillTree.localised_description: The largest of cats were truly kingly gifts to the Nehekharans, a sign of Basth made manifest. These great beasts in life were often pampered and groomed. Left to roam the large open grounds of palaces and temples alike, for no thief would dare to steal a child of Basth. Great wealth was paid in particular for Panthers and other black furred cats, for this was said to be Basth’s favoured form. In death these immortal companions were often ensorcelled at ruinous expense. Their claws tipped with exotic metals and poisons and their tails given golden sheathes.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +15% for Bastethi and Greater Bastethi units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -10% for Bastethi and Greater Bastethi units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The armies of Zandri and Numas who had combined their forces to overthrow the Second Dynasty of Khemri were said to be bewildered at the pace of the lightning counterattacks which greeted their invading forces. Like mere shadows flitting through the desert night Rasut’s heavily outnumbered forces would spring from ambushes, cause vicious and bloody wounds, and quickly begone. Perhaps even worse, their men’s morale plummeted like a stone when they realised that the abundance of feline attackers could only be a sign from the Goddess of Love herself. Fearing that they could be denied ever the chance at love or friendship again, many threw down their arms and started for the nearest Temple of Basth to beg for forgiveness so that their lover, and maybe even their wife as well, wouldn’t forsake them.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -50% for Bastethi and Greater Bastethi units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

skillTree.localised_description: It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.

skillTree.localised_description: Dark litanies are uttered to restore the Tomb Kings' slain soldiers to a twisted, chattering imitation of life.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.

skillTree.localised_description: It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

items.colour_text: Armour to a Priestess of Basth is a burden, and for Rasut her magic and this sanctified facemask of her goddess has forever been the only protective covering ever needed. Instead of protecting Rasut this facemask inspires those beings of Basth around her. A flux and focus to the realm of souls it empowers these divine animals to remember more their predator ways, while at the same time empowering its user with a cats grace.

	(Lord's army)

item_set.description: The High Priestess of Basth is once again reunited with her Gods most powerful earthly icons.

	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Bastethi and Greater Bastethi units
	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: Few in Nehekahara would doubt that the Priestesses of Basth were well protected, for while Basth is the goddess of love, she is also the goddess of cats and her clergy are well able to hunt, stalk and kill their prey. These twin daggers were once one of the most sacred objects of Khemri’s Temple of Basth. Imbued by the Mortuary Cult the wielder takes on aspects of Basth in her guise as a predator. Snatched up by Rasut as she ran down to the Temple steps to find the murderers of her King doing their butchers work, the daggers were put to good use in quickly executing her beloveds killers. Through these daggers the power of Basth flowed to give Rasut the power and grace to take the royal court and quickly throw back her many enemies.

phases.onscreen_name: The power and grace of the Goddess of Cats flows into Rasut!

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

item_set.name: Feline Vestments
item_set.description: The High Priestess of Basth is once again reunited with her Gods most powerful earthly icons.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Bastethi and Greater Bastethi units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Bastethi and Greater Bastethi units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The pregnant Priestess of Love who became Queen, Rasut's devotion to her slain beloved King was said to have moved Basth herself to tears. She is said to have bestowed on her favourite daughter the strength and skills to become like a lioness, protecting Khemri from the jackals of Zandri and Numas. Queen Rasut in life burned like a quick candle working tirelessly to strengthen her people, to leave her son and legacy protected. Her striking forces were said to be as quick and slashing as her daggers. A lightning fast stream of battles which kept the forces of her enemies at bay to once again secure Khemri's borders. Though her reign was short she was beloved by her people and given the highest of honours by the Mortuary Cult upon her death in battle.

effects.description:
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for all units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

ui_effects.localised_text: Activates automatically when conditions are met
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

phases.onscreen_name: Empowered by the High Priestess of the Goddess of Cats, Grace and Love!

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Armour to a Priestess of Basth is a burden, and for Rasut her magic and this sanctified facemask of her goddess has forever been the only protective covering ever needed. Instead of protecting Rasut this facemask inspires those beings of Basth around her. A flux and focus to the realm of souls it empowers these divine animals to remember more their predator ways, while at the same time empowering its user with a cats grace.

effects.description:
Ward save: 10% for Bastethi and Greater Bastethi units
	(Lord's army)
